title: Ticket #5851: If possible, check for service limits before doing bulk request.
description:
It doesn't make a whole lot of sense to make a request we know can't be satisfied because the corresponding account's limits. As Martin Kandes wrote on 2016-08-17, 

> I think AWS Trusted Advisor (see [1]) may be the way to go about
> programmatically checking what service limits might be placed on
> any condor_annex order.
[...]
[1] https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/ta-faqs/

Not sure what the right response to a failed check would be -- try it again later? How would we indicate what the problem was?
remarks:
2016-Sep-07 16:15:49 by tlmiller:
As Martin Kandes put its, 'especially if you expect non-experts to deploy it safely ... some friendly warnings would be good to see.' We should also, when warning if something fails because of an account limit, include the URL for requesting an account limit increase.
